text: Cleavage of transcription factor <extra_id_0> SP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by caspases during anti-IgM - induced B-cell apoptosis .
Apoptosis is instrumental in the processes generating the diversity of the B-cell repertoire .
Autoreactive B-cells are eliminated by anti-IgM crosslinking after encountering self-antigens , but precise mechanisms leading to B-cell apoptosis are still not well understood .
We report here the cleavage of the transcription factor <extra_id_0> SP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the human Burkitt lymphoma cell line BL60 during anti-IgM - induced apoptosis .
Western blot analysis revealed two cleavage products of approximately 68 kDa and 45 kDa after induction of apoptosis .
Cleavage could be completely inhibited by zDEVD-fmk , an inhibitor specific for caspase 3-like proteases .

In-vitro cleavage of recombinant <extra_id_0> SP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by recombinant <extra_id_0> caspase 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> CPP32 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) or <extra_id_0> caspase 7 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> Mch 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) results in similar cleavage products as those observed in vivo .

Recombinant <extra_id_0> caspase 6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> Mch 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) primarily generates a 68-kDa cleavage product , as observed after calcium ionophore ( CaI ) induced B-cell apoptosis .

In contrast , <extra_id_0> caspase 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ICE <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) did not cleave <extra_id_0> SP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in vitro .

The time course of <extra_id_0> SP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cleavage during anti-IgM - induced apoptosis is paralleled by an increase of caspase activity measured by DEVD-p-nitroanilide ( DEVD-pNA ) cleavage .

DNA band-shift assays revealed a decrease in the intensity of the full length <extra_id_0> SP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / DNA complex and an increase in the intensity of a smaller complex due to the binding of one <extra_id_0> SP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cleavage product .

By Edman sequencing we could identify a <extra_id_0> caspase 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cleavage site after Asp584 ( D584AQPQAGR ) , generating a 22-kDa C-terminal <extra_id_0> SP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein fragment which still contains the DNA binding site .

Our results show the cleavage of the human transcription factor <extra_id_0> SP1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in vivo and in vitro , underlining the central role of <extra_id_0> caspase 3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - like proteases during the process of anti-IgM - induced apoptosis .
